question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
If
\[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 3^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 45^\circ) = 2^n,\]then find $n.$
inference:
Solution:
From the angle addition formula,
\[\tan (A + B) = \frac{\tan A + \tan B}{1 - \tan A \tan B}.\]Then
\[1 - \tan A \tan B = \frac{\tan A + \tan B}{\tan (A + B)}.\]Hence,
\begin{align*}
(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ) &= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 3^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 2^\circ + \tan 3^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 2^\circ + \tan 3^\circ}{\tan 3^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot (1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ).
\end{align*}Similarly,
\begin{align*}
(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 3^\circ) &= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot (1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ) \cdot \frac{\tan 3^\circ + \tan 4^\circ}{\tan 7^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 7^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 3^\circ + \tan 4^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot (1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ).
\end{align*}Continuing in this way, we get
\begin{align*}
&(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 3^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 45^\circ) \\
&= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 45^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 3^\circ + \tan 4^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 5^\circ + \tan 6^\circ}{\tan 7^\circ} \dotsm \frac{\tan 43^\circ + \tan 44^\circ}{\tan 45^\circ} \cdot (1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ)(1 + \tan 4^\circ \tan 5^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 42^\circ \tan 43^\circ).
\end{align*}Since $\tan 45^\circ = 1,$ this simplifies to
\[(1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ)(1 + \tan 4^\circ \tan 5^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 42^\circ \tan 43^\circ) \cdot (\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ)(\tan 3^\circ + \tan 4^\circ) \dotsm (\tan 43^\circ + \tan 44^\circ).\]We can pair up the factors:
\begin{align*}
&(\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ)(\tan 43^\circ + \tan 44^\circ) \\
&= \tan 1^\circ \tan 43^\circ + \tan 1^\circ \tan 44^\circ + \tan 2^\circ \tan 43^\circ + \tan 2^\circ \tan 44^\circ \\
&= \tan 1^\circ \tan (45^\circ - 2^\circ) + \tan 1^\circ \tan (45^\circ - 1^\circ) + \tan 2^\circ \tan (45^\circ - 1^\circ) + \tan 2^\circ \tan (45^\circ - 2^\circ) \\
&= \tan 1^\circ \cdot \frac{1 - \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 2^\circ} + \tan 1^\circ \cdot \frac{1 - \tan 1^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ} + \tan 2^\circ \cdot \frac{1 - \tan 1^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ} + \tan 2^\circ \cdot \frac{1 - \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 2^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ - \tan 1^\circ - \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ} + \frac{2 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ - \tan 1^\circ - \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ} \\
&= \frac{4 + 2 \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ - 2 \tan 1^\circ - 2 \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ} \\
&= 2.
\end{align*}Similarly, all the other pairs are equal to 2, so the product is $2^{21}.$  Therefore, $n = \boxed{21}.$
Final Answer: $\boxed{21}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Note that for any angle $x,$ from the angle subtraction formula,
\begin{align*}
(1 + \tan x)(1 + \tan (45^\circ - x)) &= (1 + \tan x) \left( 1 + \frac{\tan 45^\circ - \tan x}{1 + \tan 45^\circ \tan x} \right) \\
&= (1 + \tan x) \left( 1 + \frac{1 - \tan x}{1 + \tan x} \right) \\
&= 1 + \tan x + 1 - \tan x \\
&= 2.
\end{align*}Thus, taking $x = 1^\circ,$ $2^\circ,$ $\dots,$ $22^\circ,$ we get
\begin{align*}
(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 44^\circ) &= 2, \\
(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 43^\circ) &= 2, \\
&\dots, \\
(1 + \tan 22^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) &= 2.
\end{align*}Hence,
\[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 44^\circ) = 2^{22}.\]Then
\[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 44^\circ)(1 + \tan 45^\circ) = 2^{23},\]which means $n = \boxed{23}.$

question:
Solution:
From the angle addition formula,
\[\tan (A + B) = \frac{\tan A + \tan B}{1 - \tan A \tan B}.\]Then
\[1 - \tan A \tan B = \frac{\tan A + \tan B}{\tan (A + B)}.\]Hence,
\begin{align*}
(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ) &= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 3^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 2^\circ + \tan 3^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 2^\circ + \tan 3^\circ}{\tan 3^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot (1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ).
\end{align*}Similarly,
\begin{align*}
(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 3^\circ) &= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot (1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ) \cdot \frac{\tan 3^\circ + \tan 4^\circ}{\tan 7^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 7^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 3^\circ + \tan 4^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot (1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ).
\end{align*}Continuing in this way, we get
\begin{align*}
&(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 3^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 45^\circ) \\
&= \frac{\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ}{\tan 45^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 3^\circ + \tan 4^\circ}{\tan 5^\circ} \cdot \frac{\tan 5^\circ + \tan 6^\circ}{\tan 7^\circ} \dotsm \frac{\tan 43^\circ + \tan 44^\circ}{\tan 45^\circ} \cdot (1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ)(1 + \tan 4^\circ \tan 5^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 42^\circ \tan 43^\circ).
\end{align*}Since $\tan 45^\circ = 1,$ this simplifies to
\[(1 + \tan 2^\circ \tan 3^\circ)(1 + \tan 4^\circ \tan 5^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 42^\circ \tan 43^\circ) \cdot (\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ)(\tan 3^\circ + \tan 4^\circ) \dotsm (\tan 43^\circ + \tan 44^\circ).\]We can pair up the factors:
\begin{align*}
&(\tan 1^\circ + \tan 2^\circ)(\tan 43^\circ + \tan 44^\circ) \\
&= \tan 1^\circ \tan 43^\circ + \tan 1^\circ \tan 44^\circ + \tan 2^\circ \tan 43^\circ + \tan 2^\circ \tan 44^\circ \\
&= \tan 1^\circ \tan (45^\circ - 2^\circ) + \tan 1^\circ \tan (45^\circ - 1^\circ) + \tan 2^\circ \tan (45^\circ - 1^\circ) + \tan 2^\circ \tan (45^\circ - 2^\circ) \\
&= \tan 1^\circ \cdot \frac{1 - \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 2^\circ} + \tan 1^\circ \cdot \frac{1 - \tan 1^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ} + \tan 2^\circ \cdot \frac{1 - \tan 1^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ} + \tan 2^\circ \cdot \frac{1 - \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 2^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ - \tan 1^\circ - \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ} + \frac{2 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ - \tan 1^\circ - \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ} \\
&= \frac{4 + 2 \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ - 2 \tan 1^\circ - 2 \tan 2^\circ}{1 + \tan 1^\circ \tan 2^\circ} \\
&= 2.
\end{align*}Similarly, all the other pairs are equal to 2, so the product is $2^{21}.$  Therefore, $n = \boxed{21}.$
Final Answer: $\boxed{21}$. I hope it is correct.

ground_truth:
Note that for any angle $x,$ from the angle subtraction formula,
\begin{align*}
(1 + \tan x)(1 + \tan (45^\circ - x)) &= (1 + \tan x) \left( 1 + \frac{\tan 45^\circ - \tan x}{1 + \tan 45^\circ \tan x} \right) \\
&= (1 + \tan x) \left( 1 + \frac{1 - \tan x}{1 + \tan x} \right) \\
&= 1 + \tan x + 1 - \tan x \\
&= 2.
\end{align*}Thus, taking $x = 1^\circ,$ $2^\circ,$ $\dots,$ $22^\circ,$ we get
\begin{align*}
(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 44^\circ) &= 2, \\
(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 43^\circ) &= 2, \\
&\dots, \\
(1 + \tan 22^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) &= 2.
\end{align*}Hence,
\[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 44^\circ) = 2^{22}.\]Then
\[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 44^\circ)(1 + \tan 45^\circ) = 2^{23},\]which means $n = \boxed{23}.$
